job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bronx, NY
pros:
PRFI is an institution of excellence. The provision of services is superb in comparison to other NYC agencies. Their Leadership is interested in educating their employees of evidence based methods which enhanced our therapeutic techniques.

PRFI was recently accredited by the Committee of Quality Leadership, given them a higher ranking in services delivery.

Everyone from their services personal to the executive team have shown great compassion to their staff and our ability to grow professional and as better human beings. 

The changes seen at PRFI are new, since new leadership came into place.

As always, you will see individuals with difficulties challenging new structural pattern of job responsibilities, but overall, we are very impressed for the positive atmosphere seen in all programs.

By having a new vision in how to run our Institute in these turbulent times, by providing support, open door policies, flexible working hours, continue education and a variety of other benefits, we are very different than others and for that we are grateful. Thank you PRFI!
cons: Dedicated employees, willing to improve practices to benefit all participants

review_title: A self serving CEO that lacks compassion

job_title: Care Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Coworkers are friendly, schedule flexibility since you work in the field you pretty much makeup your own schedule. Health insurance is good (even though a bit expensive)
cons: Everything. Very low salaries, no training provided, lack of proper communication, very high expectations and you get no support or the tools to do your job properly, management is a mess and they are completely out of touch with the day to day of our position (hence why they have such unrealistic expectations), very long caseload, very high turn over (people quit this place almost daily), absolutely no room for growth, NO salary increase (ever), lack of organization, these people operate like it's the 90's, computer equipment is outdated, the kitchens (also known as conference rooms and chart rooms so you have too see your clients while someone is heating up their food or filing their paperwork) are dirty and  barely get cleaned, and sometimes they do not take out the garbage and it just stinks. TOO MUCH endless nonsense paperwork that is not efficient at all, policies that do not make sense. This place is just a mess.

review_title: It's a great place to start off and get experience in the field. Its beneficial to be organized and self motivated.
job_title: Team Leader in New York, NY
pros: I had many passionate and experienced colleagues who worked very hard. The flexibility for care coordinators is great, as long as you are able to be self motivated. If you work hard you can get some great experience, and network with alot of different entities withing health homes, and DOHMH.
cons: There are several colleagues that do not work hard, and it seems there is not enough rewards for those who make a diligent effort to do quality work.  There is a lack of communication among the different departments which add a level of unnecessary beurocracy.

job_title: Case Planner in Bronx, NY
pros: Flexible schedule, own office, no micro management.
cons: The supervisor is useless and tried to put her own workload on the case planners. The supervisor was barely there. When she was there all she would do is gossip with the director. The director and the supervisor always sat around gossiping about the clients, the employees, and the agency as a whole. They never were present for meetings with ACS or assisted with clients that were non compliant.

review_title: Most unprofessional place to work at
job_title: Middle Management in New York, NY
pros: There's nothing positive about this organization. Reconsider before applying to this place. There are good staff here but tarnished by poor role model
cons: Enormous staff turnover. Organization has had several different leaders within a short time span. However, the current one is the worst. She  lacks knowledge, experience and most importantly, professionalism. Engages in trash talk about other staff members all the time. Has excessive poor boundaries among many other things.  Worst leader the organization has ever had. Spiteful and inconsiderate. lawsuits rule the organization.

review_title: A good and challenging position which I would had liked to continue excelling and providing services to their clientel.
